deck: Space station in the Star Trek universe and the central location of the eponymous TV show.
description:
Overview

The station the Star Trek spin-off was named after. Built by Bajorn slave labour under Cardassian occupation and originally named Terok Nor, it is currently under Starfleet supervision, although it is property of Bajor.

Located at the mouth of the Gamma Quadrant wormhole.

deck: A town in the United Kingdom which is home to the majority of characters appearing in The Beano.
description:
All the major characters in The Beano and BeanoMAX live in Beanotown including Dennis the Menace, Minnie the Minx, Roger the Dodger and the Bash Street kids. The characters will often crossover into each others strips. Ball Boy plays for the local team called Beanotown Juniors.

The locations in Beanotown are very inconsistent usually suiting whatever the storyline needs. There is even a Beanotown Space Centre where the pupils from Super School helped launch a rocket into space. Two of the few permanent locations in Beanotown are Bash Street School, and Beanotown Wood, which is home to Splodge the Goblin.

Roger the Dodger used Boogle Maps. ' Beanotown's very own real-time internet map', to spy on various places in the town. Among these were the Bash St. School, Lord Snooty's Bunkerton Castle, Beanotown School and the home of Dennis.

There is a rivalry between Beanotown and Dandytown (where the majority of the Dandy characters live). Other locations in this world is the nearby Whizztown, home to Billy Whizz, Crosspatch on the English/Scottish border which is home to the Jocks and the Geordies and Cactusville, an American town where Desperate Dan lives.

Other Media

Dennis the Menace Animated Series (1996)

Beanotown featured in Dennis the Menace's first cartoon series. Locations include a barber, a shopping mall, and a treehouse complete with a tunnel that leads into Dennis's house.

Dennis and Gnasher Animated Series (2009)

Beanotown also features in the more recent Dennis and Gnasher cartoon with locations such as Beanotown School and Scrimp Tower which in the Beanotown's business centre. In one episode Dennis' mum enters the 'Beanotown in Bloom' garden contest.

Beanotown Racing Video Game

In 2003 Beanotown Racing was released for the PC. The racing game involved characters from both The Beano and The Dandy pitted against each other. Two of the tracks in the game are set in Beanotown and in the Bash Street School.

Official Website

The official Beano website used to be called Beanotown.

issue_credits.name: The Last Ever Dandy Summer Special

name: Beanotown

volume_credits.name: The Beano presents Dennis the Menace and Gnasher

deck: Comic Fusion is a comic book shop located in Flemington, NJ.
description:
Location  

 
42 Main Street 
Flemington, NJ 08822   
Comic Fusion Comic Books and Collectibles  
 
  
Each year in October the store particpates in an event entitled Wonder Woman Day / Superhero Weekend.  A silent auction is held, and many artists appear for commisions.  Many artists have appeared at the store, including Michael Dolce (writer / artist for 'The Sire'), and Eric Hesse (artist on 'The Key').  One of their most renown guests is Joe Sinnott, an artist who has worked most prominently on the Fantastic Four. 
 
The store has a large selection of books from all publishers, trades, and many statues, action figures, and other assorted merchandise, including HeroClix.

deck: BaT Comics is a comic book shop in Chico, California.
description:
BaT Comics & Games  has been in business in downtown Chico since 1993.  They are the largest  inventory comic books and comic book collectibles in the area, but also carry various games; including:  Pocket Model Games, Collectible Card Games, Miniatures Games, Role Playing Games, and Board games. They offer various tournaments and leagues for these games as well as open play. You can also buy their merchandise from Ebay.

deck: Bankston's Comics and Collectibles is a store in Waco, Texas that specializes in comic books, sports collectibles, and trading card games.
description:
Origins and General Information

Bankston's Comics and Collectibles was established in 1985 by brothers Brad and Brent Bankston.  Originally, the store began as Bankston's Used Books as a section of their parents' tire and appliance business.  Mainly hardcover and paperback books were sold, but the brothers quickly realized that the collectibles industry was poised to boom.  Eventually, they began carrying comic books and sports cards, as well as action figures and other items of collector interest as time passed. 
 
Bankston's would become a prominent figure in keeping comics alive in Waco, and business did so well that the brothers expanded their business into Austin, TX with Austin Books & Comics.  Brad Bankston overlooks operations of Austin Books, while Brent manages Bankston's in Waco. 
 
With the boom of comic book-influenced films, Bankston's typically features a booth at the local theaters with memorabilia from the movie that is premiering.  Previous instances include the release of X-Men, X-Men 2, Iron Man, Spider-Man, Spider-Man 2, Spider-Man 3, 
 
Bankston's is also a yearly participant in Free Comic Book Day, allowing any patrons to pick up any three of the Gold and Silver comics that are released on the day. 
 

Comic Books  

Featuring 8-foot cabinetry, Bankston's carries all of the latest ongoing series from the hottest and biggest names in the industry, as well as another section for independent releases from smaller companies.  A separate section of cabinetry is dedicated to trade paperbacks and hardcovers.  If something is not available, it can be ordered for delivery.
 

Sports Memorabilia  

Behind the counter, as well as in other portions of the store, customers can find a large amount of collector's items associated to various sports.  This ranges from a massive assortment of trading cards dating all the way back to Mickey Mantle, special framed moments (like Nolan Ryan punching out Robin Ventura on the mound in 1993), and other signed and autographed memorabilia. 
 

Action Figures  

A back area of the store features a large array of collectible action figures from all eras, including Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, rare Nightmare Before Christmas figures, and even more obscure figures. 
 

Trading Card Games  

Ranging from Magic The Gathering to Yu-gi-oh to World of Warcraft, Bankston's offers all the latest booster packs and starter decks for the hottest trading card games around.  Every Saturday morning, they host special time in the store specifically for playing trading card games. 
 

eBay Auctions   

Aside from offering items in-store, Bankston's also offers the ability to purchase items via eBay.  These items typically fall into the category of sports memorabilia, although a large variety are available. 
 

In-Store Signings

From time to time, Bankston's will feature in-store signings with comic writers, sports figures, etc.  Previous signings include the likes of Matt Sturges ( Fables).

Comic Vine Ambassadors

  • jakob187
name: Bankston's Comics and Collectibles

deck: OK Comics is the last surviving independent, Eisner Nominated, book shop in Leeds, England. It specialises in Comics and Graphic Novels of all kinds. They stock everything from Action Adventure to Norwegian Silent Romance Comics & offer a Free Lending Library Service.
description:
Location

       
19 Thornton's Arcade,  
Briggate 
Leeds 
West Yorkshire 
LS1 6LQ  
England  
shop@okcomics.co.uk 
okcomics 
 
  

Comic Vine Ambassadors

  • Gylan Thomas
 
As well as the innovative Free Lending Library Service, OK organises regular "drink and draw" sessions giving comic fans the chance to meet other fans and discuss their passion over their favourite tipple, with pencils and paper on hand.  There's even a sofa and coffee machine in store so when you have a little time to kill you can sit and read.   
 
Every year Free Comic Book Day (which is rarely celebrated in the UK) is a cause for celebration in OK Comics, and there are often creator signings for fans. 
 
Add all this to the staff's passion and knowledge of comics it's easy to see how they've won several local retail awards in the Leeds area and even been nominated for the "Spirit of Comics’ Retail Award" in 2009's Eisners.
name: OK Comics

deck: Second Time Around is a flee-market from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles comic. It is owned and run by April. April and Turtles live in the building where Second time around is located.
description:
April starts running Second Time Around.

April inherited Second Time Around from her father when he died. After it came into daylight that Aprils boss Baxter Stockman was a madman and was imprisoned from his crimes against New York City, April stopped being computer scientist and started running Second Time Around. When the Shredder comes back in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 9 (in story Silent Partner), the Turtles meet him in Second Time Around and battle him there. It is burned down after the battle with the rest of the building. April takes it very hard, because the building and shop were everything she had.
name: Second Time Around

deck: The T.C.R.I. Building is a building where an alien race called the Utroms hide from human eyes in the world of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
description:
Turtles find the T.C.R.I Building

The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles first come across the T.C.R.I Building when they are been abused by Foot-soldiers in the "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles #4" comic book. Their master Splinter has just gone missing and they have moved out of the sewers (where they previously lived) with April in the apartment building owned by her. The Turtles are out to get some air in the rooftops of New York when suddenly a group of Foot-soldiers ambushes them and a fight through rooftops begins. When Raphael is about to finish the last Foot-soldier he notices something in the roof of the building next to the one they are fighting. The four letters are T.C.R.I. The same letters that are printed in the side of the mysterious container that was responsible for their transformation.

Investigating T.C.R.I Building

The Turtles decide to go investigate the building in the hope of getting some answer to their origins. Inside they find long hallways with just one window. After a while they find a ID-card (key-card). With the ID-card they manage to open one of the doors in the hallway and enter the room. In the room they find their master Splinter in suspended animation. At the same time the Utroms have noticed the intruders and attack the Turtles with their stun guns. The Turtles start to defend themselves and end up in the Transmat Device (like a teleporter) which transfers them to a faraway planet. The transportation causes a giant light phenomenon. The Phenomenon gets the attention of the police and the media and the Utroms seals the whole building.

Back from the space

The Utroms manages to retrieve the Turtles from space in "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles #7". When they came back Splinter had awoken from the suspended animation and tells the Turtles that the Utroms were trying to heal him and that the Utroms have no evil intentions. They have been trying to build a Transmat Device and had just got it working when the Turtles broke in the building. The Utroms just wanted to go to their home planet. At that time the National guard had been called in to the seen. They storm in the building and the Utroms and Turtles escape trough the Transmat Device. The Utroms also blow up the T.C.R.I Building so there would not be any evidence of their visit on earth.
name: T.C.R.I. Building

volume_credits.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Color Classics

deck: Oswald Cobblepot's infamous Restaurant and club, mainly for Batman's Rogues and other Gotham Criminals.
description:
The Iceberg Lounge is the Penguin's Base of Operations and the Hippest Night-Club in Gotham. Oswald Cobblepot opened it after he gave up his life of crime, but often only uses it as an excuse against Batman to cover up most of his illegal activities.

The Staff consists of The Penguin Himself, and his three co-horts; Jay, Lark and Raven, Who usually act as Waitresses when busness Goes smoothly, but often double as Cobblepot's Henchmen if another Super-Criminal becomes too hostile, or if Batman drops by... Which He does in almost all of the Lounge's Appearances.

The Layout of the Iceberg is fairly simple.. It has a Baby-blue antartic theme complete with a Bar, Dining Area, a Giant swimming pool in the middle of the club with a crystal iceberg statue in the center, and Several Hiden rooms along with The Penguin's Office and an Armory in the back, According to the Storyline Gotham Underground.. Oswald even has his own Personal dining area upstairs in the Lounge, where he can monitor over the entire club.

Almost all of it's customors are either Arkham Inmates or just scattered members of organized mobs. Only a select few "Citizens" Have dared to enter the Louge, Like a nameless couple who had dinner there, who had the misfortune of sitting in the Joker's Favorite Seat, which lead to their demise. (It was later realized the Joker doesn't really have a favorite seat.) The Riddler is also a Well-known Customer of the Lounge, mainly to the bar, but has lead on to be a very close friend to Penguin, also heavily noted in Gotham Underground. It was once even revealed that Penguin had willed the Lounge to Riddler in the event of his death. Several other Blue-Collar Criminals hang there as well, such as Two-Face, The Scarecrow, Mad Hatter, and Hugo Strange.

deck: The infamous home of many powerful mages. The guild boasts a huge reputation for being loud and destructive. It is the main setting of the Fairy Tail anime and manga. It is located in the town of Magnolia. The guild has been around for over 100 years since the timeskip, having been founded in year X686. It was founded by a group of five people: Mavis Vermillion, Precht Gaebolg, Yury Dreyar, Worrod Sequen and Zera. It's current guild master is Makarov Dreyar, son of Yury Dreyar.
description:
Welcome to Fairy Tail

Located in Fiore in Magnolia Town, The guild is home to many powerful and distinguished mages. It was named Fairy Tail because the eternal mystery behind where fairies had tails or not, or if they even existed, was like an eternal adventure. Over the years, the guild has gone through many changes, mostly due to the destructive nature of the guild members. All of the guild members have a connection with one another, willing to do mostly anything to help one another. It is mostly composed of those seeing a family or mages donning the esteemed name of Fairy Tail. It has lasted many decades and to this day it relies the only home to many of its powerful mages.

Missions

Like other guilds throughout the land, the guild carries out specific requests, or Missions. All missions are assigned through the rank of mages, depending on their difficulty, duration, and reward. A-Class and lower missions are placed on the first floor and S-Class and above on the 2nd. Originally members who weren't S-class were not even allowed to go on the 2nd floor until the reconstruction, opening the 2nd floor for anyone.

Guild War

During the Phantom lord arc, the Guild was involved in a war between their rivals, the Phantom Lord guild. Phantom was willing to stop at nothing to crush Fairy Tail, including targeting its weaker members when they were alone. Though prohibited, Guild Master Makarov and all of the Fairy Tail members retaliated and put a stop to the Fallen guild. In the aftermath, Fairy Tail's guild was destroyed by Gajeel and they were forced to rebuild.

The New Guild

After the Phantom Lord arc, the guild was rebuilt and added many accommodations and new rules. One was the ability for S-class and lower mages to go on the 2nd floor. The guild was now bigger and boasted a pool as well as an indoor cafe, a toy shop, and a larger hall to eat and drink. After the war with the demon guild Tartaros, however, the guild would be destroyed again by Seilah's control over Elfman, leaving the Fairy Tail mages without a home once again. Makarov decided to disband the guild to better protect the citizens of the city, but after a year, Lucy Heartphilia and Natsu began a campaign to bring Fairy Tail back. After everyone returned, the citizens actually banded together to build them another guild.
name: Fairy Tail Guild

name: Friendly Neighborhood Comicshop

deck: A local comic book shop in San Diego, California.
description:
Location  

 
8280 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard
San Diego, CA 92111-1708
(858) 715-8669 
 

Directions

This store is located within an industrial park and directions given by Google maps and other online mapping sites may not lead you to the proper store front. The store's address is Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, but the store's actual location is on Industrial Park Driveway. Industrial Park Driveway is located between Mercury St and Kearny Mesa Road.
 
From 163:
1) Take Clairemont Mesa exit heading west
2) Turn right at Industrial Park Driveway (2nd traffic light west of  Highway163)
3) Proceed to the end of the road and park near the US flag (flag pole) and cardboard sign with an arrow that says "Comics"  
 
From 805:
1) Take Clariremont Mesa exit heading east
2) Turn left at Industrial park Driveway 
3) Proceed to the end of the road and park near the US flag (flag pole) and cardboard sign with an arrow that says "Comics"    

Hours of Operation

Sunday    12 - 5 
Monday    Closed
Tuesday - Friday    11 - 6
Saturday    10 - 5
 

Contact Information
